DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Tumor Panel Sequencing Performed Collection Tissue Biospecimen Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the tissue used for the tumor panel sequencing laboratory procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Tumor Panel Sequencing Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._An application of next-generation targeted sequencing where tumor-specific genes are selected for sequencing. Using next-generation techniques, chosen sequences can be sequenced to high depths that facilitate the identification of variants that are present at low allele frequencies._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: An application of next-generation targeted sequencing where tumor-specific genes are selected for sequencing. Using next-generation techniques, chosen sequences can be sequenced to high depths that facilitate the identification of variants that are present at low allele frequencies.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: An application of next-generation targeted sequencing where tumor-specific genes are selected for sequencing. Using next-generation techniques, chosen sequences can be sequenced to high depths that facilitate the identification of variants that are present at low allele frequencies.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The act of gathering something together._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site close to or distant from the primary site.

Concepts.definition: A malignant tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site close to or distant from the primary site.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A tumor at the original site of origin.

Concepts.definition: A tumor at the original site of origin.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The act of gathering something together.:Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
